setConfigValues

public void setConfigValues(java.util.Properties props)
Description copied from interface: ConfigService
Parse config values from Properties. Key must be a config key's Class string.
For example: 
 //file config.properties
 some.package.SomeConfigKey=value 1
 some.package.OtherConfigKey=value 2
 com.gf.key.TraceHandlers=true 
 
 //props
 InputStream is = getResourceAsStream("config.properties");
 Properties props = new Properties();
 props.load(is);

Specified by:
setConfigValues in interface ConfigService

setConfig

public <T> void setConfig(java.lang.Class<? extends ConfigKey<T>> keyType,
                          T value)
Description copied from interface: ConfigService
Set config value by key type. You can create own config keys for using in handlers.

Specified by:
setConfig in interface ConfigService
Parameters:
keyType - not null type
value - some value for this config type (can be null)

getConfig

public <T> T getConfig(ConfigKey<T> key)
Description copied from interface: ConfigService
Get config value or default value or exception if key doesn't have default value.

Specified by:
getConfig in interface ConfigService

isTrueConfig

public boolean isTrueConfig(ConfigKey<java.lang.Boolean> key)
Description copied from interface: ConfigService
Get boolean value of Boolean config key. If value is null return false. Anolog of ConfigService.getConfig(ConfigKey): Boolean.TRUE.equals(getConfig(key))

Specified by:
isTrueConfig in interface ConfigService
